The National Museum of Medieval Art () is a national museum dedicated to medieval art and history in Korçë, Albania. The museum is located on Fan Noli Boulevard in the south-east of the city of Korçë. It was established in April 24, 1980, and the building was reconstructed in October 4, 2016, with the cooperation of the city municipality and the Greek Government fund.
The museum has over 7,000 art and cultural items, mainly icons, stone, wooden, metal and textile works, representing various moments in Albania's iconography development. In the principal hall, there are many works from anonymous artists of the 13th-14th centuries and well-known ones including Onufri, Onufër Qiprioti, Teacher Kostandini, Jeromak Shpataraku, David Selenica, and the Zografi Brothers.
Due to the COVID-19 lockdown in Albania, the Ministry of Culture offers 3D tours of the museum.

The saint is depicted as sitting on a throne in the central rectangle, surrounded by scenes of his life and miracles, according to his Greek hagiography.
File:The Transfiguration of Christ.16th c.jpg|There's a standard representation of Jesus at the top in the centre, either standing or floating, flanked by the two Old Testament figures. Below, the three apostles give various reactions – usually of stunned amazement, half looking away from the radiant light.
